item.title: InZOI: How to Upload Selfies to Bubbly
item.description:
When playing InZOI , your characters will occasionally have urges that pop up in the actions bar. Fulfilling these not only keeps your Zois happy but also rewards you with Meows — the in-game currency you can spend around the city. One of these urges might ask you to Post a Selfie on Social Media, which can sometimes show up as 'Post a Selfie on Bubbly.'

For those who don’t know, Bubbly is InZOI ’s version of social media, kind of like Instagram or Facebook in the real world. This urge is all about snapping a picture of your Zoi and sharing a slice of their life online. It’s a pretty simple task, but depending on your Zoi’s Lifestyle and Traits, it can be a bit challenging, too. For those unsure, here's how to Post a Selfie on Bubbly in InZOI .

How to Upload Selfies to Bubbly in InZOI

To upload a Selfie on Bubbly in InZOI , all you need to do is click on your Zoi, select Smartphone, and scroll through the dropdown menu until you find the Post a Selfie on Social Media option . Tapping this will fulfill the urge, make your Zoi feel tranquil, and even reward you with some Meow Coins.

If the option isn’t showing up for your Zoi, that means they aren’t eligible for them just yet. So, to unlock the Upload Selfie on Social Media option in InZOI , you’ll need to raise their Challenger Value to at least 60 points. This value shows that your Zoi craves adventure and loves shaking off the usual day-to-day routine. So, once it becomes their Core Value, your Zoi will be all set to share pictures of their life and enjoy even more fun moments online.

How to Increase Challenger Value in InZOI

There are plenty of things your Zoi can do to gain more Challenger Value points in InZOI , like painting, singing, socializing, and even surfing. But here’s the catch: Doing these tasks at random won’t make much difference if your Zoi’s lifestyle and traits don’t match the Challenger Value. To reach 60 points and make it your Core Value, you’ll first need to pick a lifestyle and traits that fit.

The good news is you can switch your Desired Life anytime through the Zoi Card. Alongside the Desired Life, make sure to choose a trait that matches Challenger Value, too — the game makes it easy to spot when you’re selecting traits for your Zoi during character creation.

7 Images
7 Images

item.title: One Disney Franchise Should Inspire a Shift in Dreamlight Valley
item.description:
Disney Dreamlight Valley has made several changes and shifts since its early access debut in 2022. Most of these changes have occurred in updates, though the game's two DLC Expansion Passes, A Rift in Time and the Storybook Vale, have also added plenty of content to the hit simulation game. Despite this, Disney Dreamlight Valley ’s competitors are constantly shifting the needle of the simulation genre, proving that Disney Dreamlight Valley must stay on top of trends if it’s to remain successful.

The most notable and recent introduction into the simulation genre is Hello Kitty Island Adventure . Yet another big-name IP debut in the genre, Hello Kitty Island Adventure, has popularized and affirmed several key gameplay features of simulation games, like fishing, creature collecting, harvesting, and much more. However, Hello Kitty Island Adventure also expanded not just to explore biomes above land, but to go deep under the sea. This perspective shift is not unique to Hello Kitty Island Adventure , but its take on an underwater biome has been incredibly popular. Disney Dreamlight Valley should follow suit, not just because it would likely be a hit with its player base, but because it features several franchises that would be the perfect excuse for this addition.

The Little Mermaid Could Introduce an Underwater Biome

The Little Mermaid would be the perfect film to take Disney Dreamlight Valley underwater. After all, the film itself states that “life is better, down where it’s wetter.” Using The Little Mermaid may seem like an odd choice, given that Ariel, Prince Eric, and Ursula are already on Disney Dreamlight Valley ’s character roster. However, given that this biome would literally be underwater, rather than an above-ground water-themed biome, The Little Mermaid would be the best option.

Additionally, The Little Mermaid has been a part of Disney Dreamlight Valley since version 1.0. The franchise deserves a refresh, which is certainly possible. Disney Dreamlight Valley has used updates and DLC to add characters from franchises already present in the game. The Lion King is a notable example, with sidekicks Timon and Pumbaa joining after Nala, Simba, and Scar, in the Jungle Getaway update. Tangled also received this treatment, this time through DLC. Rapunzel and Flynn Rider both joined Disney Dreamlight Valley ’s character roster in the A Rift in Time and Storybook Vale Expansion Passes, respectively, long after Mother Gothel’s introduction in its base game. Certainly, The Little Mermaid could easily take this route.

What an Underwater Biome in Disney Dreamlight Valley Could Look Like

An underwater biome deserves underwater characters. As mentioned, the most obvious members of The Little Mermaid are already present in Disney Dreamlight Valley. However, Ariel’s sea creature friends are not. An underwater biome could easily add both Sebastian the crab and Ariel’s fish friend Flounder. Sebastian may be able to skitter across the sand, but fish obviously can’t walk. Adding Flounder specifically would justify this underwater biome, while also giving players a whole new world to explore.

However, there are some conditions for this underwater biome. Firstly, this underwater biome should be part of Disney Dreamlight Valley ’s base game. It would only make sense for all players to be able to explore this incredible new feature without a paywall blocking them. Secondly, alongside an underwater biome comes new tools used to explore it. Hello Kitty Island Adventure gives players both a snorkel and flippers. Disney Dreamlight Valley ’s Expansion Passes have both added new Royal Tools — the Royal Hourglass in the A Rift in Time expansion and the Royal Net in the Storybook Vale. Because Disney Dreamlight Valley has added tools through DLC in the past, Gameloft and Disney could view the underwater biome as a hook for the game’s third Expansion Pass. Nevertheless, given how expansive this update could be, it would only be fair for an underwater biome in Disney Dreamlight Valley to be part of its base game.

item.title: Best Strategy Games For Players Who Believe They Suck At Them
item.description:
Summary

  • Entry-level strategy games like Crusader Kings 3 provide tutorials to ease players into gameplay.
  • Age of Mythology: Retold offers accessible difficulty options suitable for both newcomers and veterans.
  • Marvel's Midnight Suns simplifies tactical gameplay, making it more beginner-friendly than XCOM.

While fans may be fans of the mindless action present in most mainstream titles, there's something about captivating strategy games that keeps players coming back for more. However, fans unfamiliar with this genre may find it daunting to get into such titles, especially if they lack the confidence to succeed in these titles.

However, players shouldn't feel intimidated by this barrier to entry. After all, several amazing strategy games are accessible and do a great job of easing players into the gameplay without making them feel overwhelmed.

8 Crusader Kings 3

The Amazing Tutorial Makes It Easy To Get Into This Grand Strategy Title

8 Images
8 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Crusader Kings 3
10
8.8 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 90 /100 Critics Rec: 99%
Released
September 1, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Paradox Interactive
Publisher(s)
Paradox Interactive
Platform(s)
PS5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Crusader Kings 3 did an incredible job of crafting a tutorial that introduces core aspects of the gameplay without overwhelming fans. The end result is a brilliant game that is surprisingly approachable for a grand strategy title.

Even players who feel that they aren't good at strategy games can get invested in the role-playing side of things and slowly learn how to optimize their rule. Over time, beginners will turn into CK3 veterans as they explore the wealth of content in this game that is slowly expanding courtesy of the many updates and expansions released by Paradox.

7 Age Of Mythology: Retold

Accessible Difficulty Modes Make It Easy To Get Into This Beloved RTS

Your comment has not been saved

Age of Mythology: Retold
8 /10
6 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 83 /100 Critics Rec: 88%
Released
September 4, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
World's Edge, Forgotten Empires, Capture Age, Tantalus Media, Virtuos
Publisher(s)
Xbox Game Studios
Platform(s)
PC, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Not only is Age of Mythology: Retold a great way to re-experience the magic of Age of Mythology for existing fans, but players unfamiliar with this title will find it easier than ever to get into one of the most beloved RTS games of all time.

It helps that the difficulty options are expanded to accommodate all kinds of players, either giving veterans a substantial challenge or letting beginners learn the ropes with minimal frustrations. All of this combines to turn Age of Mythology: Retold into an excellent remake that can ease new players into the gameplay loop of real-time strategy games.

6 Mario + Rabbids Kingdom Battle

A Great Collaboration With Simple Yet Engaging Tactical Gameplay

Your comment has not been saved

Mario + Rabbids Kingdom Battle
8 /10
8 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 85 /100 Critics Rec: 92%
Released
August 29, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Ubisoft Milan, Ubisoft Paris
Publisher(s)
Ubisoft
Platform(s)
Switch
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

The Nintendo Switch is a console stacked with amazing games, including an unlikely partnership between Nintendo and Ubisoft that combined some unlikely IPs. This led to the creation of Mario + Rabbids Kingdom Battle , an excellent strategy game that fans will have a great time with.

The tactical combat is approachable and doesn't get too overbearing, which is perfect given how accessible this title aims to be. Players who want to enjoy a fun crossover title with charming visuals and fun gameplay will have a great time with Kingdom Battle .

5 Sid Meier's Civilization 7

Despite Some Early Missteps, This Game Embodies The Beginner-Friendly Approach Of The Series

6 Images
6 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Sid Meier's Civilization VII
9 /10
15
5.5 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 80 /100 Critics Rec: 78%
Released
February 11, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Firaxis Games
Publisher(s)
2K
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch 2, Nintendo Switch, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

People who find strategy games daunting will love getting into Civilization 7 right now. The game is in its early release phase and isn't too overwhelming, making it easy for players to master the basics if they aren't familiar with how this 4X strategy game works.

It helps that the game boasts a ton of difficulty settings. Players can choose a setting they're comfortable with, giving them more leeway to make mistakes and learn from them so that they can tackle the AI at harder difficulties and test what they've learned.

4 Marvel's Midnight Suns

Compared To XCOM, The Tactical Gameplay Is Easier And More Beginner-Friendly

Your comment has not been saved

Marvel's Midnight Suns
8 /10
9.5 /10
OpenCritic Reviews

Released
December 2, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Firaxis Games
Publisher(s)
2K Games
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, PS5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Firaxis's work on the XCOM reboots was praised by many, although the hardcore gameplay and permadeath system made it daunting for strategy newbies to get into this title. This issue is a thing of the past in Marvel's Midnight Suns , a game with excellent strategic combat that should've sold more units than it did.

The story is the only negative part of a title that is incredible to play otherwise. Players will love controlling an original character who teams up with other superheroes to lay waste to their enemies while strengthening their bonds with other heroes in between battles.

3 Age Of Empires 4

A Modern Take On The Classic AoE Gameplay That Newcomers Can Ease Themselves Into

Your comment has not been saved

Age of Empires 4
8 /10
8.3 /10
OpenCritic Reviews

October 28, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Relic Entertainment, World's Edge
Publisher(s)
Xbox Game Studios
Platform(s)
PC, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Age of Empires 4 is a new entry in the series that has delighted long-time fans. It may be a bit too similar to the second game in the series for most people's liking, but this isn't necessarily a bad thing.

The updated graphics and enhanced control options ensure that Age of Empires 4 will feel great to play. The game is accessible and forgiving enough for players to learn from their mistakes without completely derailing a single-player playthrough, although the same can't be said for the game's tense multiplayer match-ups.

2 Slay The Spire

The Quintessential Roguelike Deckbuilding Game That Rewards A Strategic Approach In Combat

Your comment has not been saved

Slay the Spire
9 /10
9.3 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 89 /100 Critics Rec: 100%
Released
January 23, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Mega Crit
Publisher(s)
Humble Bundle
Platform(s)
Android, iOS, PC, Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, Xbox One
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Slay the Spire kickstarted the trend for deckbuilding roguelike games, and for good reason. The title's compelling gameplay loop sees players ascending to the top of the Spire in a bid to kill a mysterious heart and attain victory.

What makes Slay the Spire so compelling is how failure is welcomed and is a part of the learning process. Each hero will gain more abilities over time as they get stronger, giving players access to stronger cards that can be complete game-changers and make the trek through the game's three acts (or four, if players are ambitious) way easier than it has any right to be.

1 Balatro

Players Must Acquire Tactical Jokers And Play Their Hands Wisely To Clear All Eight Antes

Your comment has not been saved

Balatro
15
9.5 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 92 /100 Critics Rec: 100%
Released
February 20, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Developer(s)
LocalThunk
Publisher(s)
Playstack
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, PS5, Switch, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

The combination of poker with roguelike mechanics allows Balatro to stand out as one of the greatest indie video games ever made. The simple yet compelling gameplay loop is easy to understand, to the point where players who have no clue how to play poker will have no problem getting into this addicting title.

Balatro 's allure becomes clear to players when they rack up points and multipliers to get insanely high scores with ease. Once players get a taste of success in Balatro , it's hard to stop as players become more obsessed with completing all eight antes with each deck.
